page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES - ONE
page.content: The area lies mainly in the parish of {Middle Rasen}but also includes part of {Kirkby-cum-Osgodby}and{Walesby.}75% of the area is{arable farmland}growing crops such as barley, wheat, potatoes and cultivated grassland. The other 25% is mainly{coniferous woodland.} There is a little{meat production}with cattle and pigs. The light fertile soil means there is good{drainage.}There are a few natural ponds and old brick pits. Over the last few years{agricultural reserviors have been constructed to provide irrigation. The area is sparsely populated with scattered{farmhouses}occupied by farmworkers or people who work in nearby towns such as Market Rasen, Lincoln, Grimsby and on the Humber Bank.
